This week a Congressional resolution was signed permitting schools nationwide the opportunity to provide all children 18 and under meals in their district. Danville Schools will be opting to use this program. This will allow us to be able to serve ALL children in the family under the age of 18. Parents are now permitted to pick up meals for their children just as we did this past summer.

For food pickup:

Use the bus lanes at Toliver Intermediate, 209 N. Maple Avenue or Hogsett Primary, 300 Waveland Drive. When exiting your vehicle, please practice social distancing (6 Feet) and wear a mask. Proceed to the door in front of the cafeteria. The food service worker will place your meals on the table for you to pick up. You will receive a breakfast and lunch at the same time. Pick up times are 10:30 – 1:30 daily Monday through Friday. We will begin this on Tuesday, Sept 8th.

We look forward to providing your children their favorite school meals. Your participation is encouraged and so appreciated.

Nineteen Kentucky public high school students have been selected to join the Commissioner’s Student Advisory Council for the 2020-21 year, the Kentucky Department of Education (KDE) announced on July 20.

The council was established to provide feedback on critical issues impacting students and schools and works with KDE staff to develop ideas to improve and transform education.

The group meets with the commissioner and KDE staff, both in person and virtually, to discuss how decisions made at the state level are affecting students throughout Kentucky.

More than 140 students from across the Commonwealth applied for a spot on the advisory council this year. Applications were blind-scored by a panel of judges from across Kentucky

Congratulations to our own Sofie Farmer! Sofie is currently a senior attending the Gatton Academy.
